comments:
Applies To:

Eclipse SDK
Version: 3.3.0
Build id: I20070625-1500

Actual Results:

If there is not enough space on that partition (NTSF), and I close Eclipse, then most of my preferences (such as layout, editor settings, compiler settings) are lost (without warning) and I have to set them again the next time. 

Additionally, when I saved my project in that context some errors were signaled about some classes which could not be saved. The message said the project may be inconsistent and suggest to refresh it. I though it was because some changes on my source code required rebuilding from scratch, but the real cause was not enough free hard disk space. The error message on that situation could be more explicit. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a project in Eclipse
2. Fill up all the free space on the partition where the workspace is located.
3. Modify the project and save.
4. Exit Eclipse.

Additional Builds and Platforms:
I have not experienced these problems with Version: 3.0.0 (Build id: 200406251208).

Do you have a log file available from when this occurred (workspace/.metadata/.log)? There are likely a number of unrelated issues here, but a log file would help track down what's happening. This needs more investigation, but may be an issue with preference rather than resources.

Created an attachment (id=75955)
error log

There are several ocurrences of 
	java.io.IOException: Espacio en disco insuficiente
and
	!MESSAGE Could not write file ...

the bug I submit happened frequently on 2007-08-11 and sometimes in the later days.

Roberto, in the log file you attached I can see a number of problems.

1) Saving preferences while executing Preferences#store:

Like John said, I belive it's more an issue with preference and builder rather than resources component. At the same time I'm quite concerned with the fact that you have not experienced these problems with a previous version. Are you sure that conditions were the same i.e. you've ran out of disk space but even though still able to save your workspace?
